indicator_name: Proportion of children under six years receiving pre-primary education
graph_title: Proportion of children under six years receiving pre-primary education
goal_name: 4. Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
target_name: 4.2 By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys have access to quality early childhood development, care and pre‐primary education so that they are ready for primary education
indicator_name1: 4.2.2.1 Proportion of children under the age of six who receive pre-school education
organization_name: The National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Social Statistics Division)
definitions: Preschool education coverage is defined as the ratio of the number of children attending preschool institutions to the number of children aged 1-6 years according to demographic statistics adjusted for the number of 6-year-olds enrolled in school.
concepts: Education is a priority strategic direction of the state policy of the Kyrgyz Republic.Education in the Kyrgyz Republic is based on the principles proclaimed in international treaties and covenants, in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, on the principles of democracy and humanistic values of the people, world culture. The basic principles of the organization of education are: - equality of the rights of all citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic to receive quality education; - the obligation and free of charge for every citizen to receive primary, basic general and secondary general education in state and municipal educational institutions; - consistency and continuity of the educational process; etc.In the late 90s, most regions of the republic experienced a decrease in pre-school enrollment. The reasons for this are the closure of preschool institutions, a decrease in family incomes and an increase in direct tuition costs, which affected, first of all, children from low–income families and families living in rural areas.
rationale_interpretation: The educational enrolment ratio (gross enrolment ratio) is defined as the ratio of the number of children, regardless of age, enrolled in a certain level of education to the total number of children in the appropriate age group, which is set for this level of education.The net enrollment rate is defined as the ratio of the number of children in the official age group enrolled in a certain level of education to the total number of children in the corresponding age group, which is set for this level of education.
data_sources: State Statistical Reporting Form No. 85- K "Preschool Organization Report"
data_collection: Preschool educational organizations, regardless of their form of ownership
computation_methods: The ratio of the number of children attending preschool institutions to the number of children aged 1-6 years according to demographic statistics adjusted for the number of 6-year-olds enrolled in school.
comments_limitations: According to the data analysis, every fourth child attends kindergarten, the Law on Education states that every citizen of the Kyrgyz Republic has the right to education regardless of gender, nationality, language, social and property status, limited health opportunities, type and nature of occupation, religion, political and religious beliefs, place of residence and other circumstances.
quality_assurance: After filling out the report, logical and arithmetic control is performed.
data_availability_gaps: Publications in the education and science authorities of the Republic of Kazakhstan, http://www.stat.kg/ru/publications/sbornik-obrazovanie-i-nauka-v-kyrgyzskoj-respublike/
disaggregation: By territory, gender, and age groups
